intro: Pedicularis alaica, commonly known as the Alpine beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of tubular, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Pedicularis alaica is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
